eu_initiatives: The European College of Animal Welfare and Behavioral Medicine- is bringing together all veterinarians having a specialist degree in animal welfare. They follow all EU inititiatives in the field of animal welfare and behavioural medicine
organisation_name: European College of Animal Welfare and Behavioural Medicine (ECAWBM)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication:
Our college gives - through its experts - input to members of the different EU institutions (Commission, European Parliament and Council) into the development of legislative acts in the field of animal welfare.  
 
Some examples of legislative acts in which ECAWBM was involved are:  
- on pig welfare Council Directive 2008/120/EC + guidelines pig welfare (tail docking, enrichment material) 
- on welfare of broilers  Council Directive 2007/43/CE 
- on welfare of laying hens Council Directive 1999/74/EC  
- on welfare around the transport of animals Regulation 1/2005/EC 
- on welfare around slaughter Council Regulation (EC) N° 1099/2009 
 
Members of our College are also occasionally invited to speak giving as experts at hearings of the European Parliament, or in consultative or advisory groups of the European Commission (such as on pig welfare guidelines), we are in the  database of the European Medicines Agency to be consulted on all welfare issues regarding veterinary medicines, etc.  
The President of our college has also chaired several EFSA Working Groups on welfare.  
 
Yearly also ECAWBM organises an annual meeting, in which we also invite EU legislators to speak or to attend.
